references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), a key component for efficient high-resolution image synthesis that is utilized in this study.
This foundational paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), which are the basis for the diffusion models that ProReflow aims to improve.

references.paper_title: Flow straight and fast: Learning to generate and transfer data with rectified flow
references.reason: This paper proposes rectified flow, the technique upon which the current paper improves.

references.paper_title: Progressive distillation for fast sampling of diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces progressive distillation for diffusion models, which serves as the foundations for few-step inference of the model.
This paper introduces flow matching as a generative modelling strategy, which aims to train a model to match the velocity field of a given data distribution, and serves as an important reference.
